page.title: 19 TOWN CENTRE DEVELOPMENT
page.content:
In the late 1960's in common with many other towns Bury underwent a rapid redevelopment programme. A new market and shopping precinct were built and expansion has continued ever since. Bury is now with Bolton one of the major shopping centres in North Manchester. The central shopping area contains most of the major chain stores and around Angouleme Way ( Bury's twin town ) large retail units are located. One of the features of all development has been a large degree of pedestrianisation, and free car park. The town is especially busy on market days which are Wednesday, Friday and Saturday. Early closing is on Tuesday, but this is not uniformly observed.
